name: magistrate
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
C1 a person who acts as a judge in a law court that deals with crimes that are less serious: He will appear before the magistrates tomorrow. Greenway appeared at Bow Street Magistrates' Court to face seven charges of accepting bribes.
More examplesFewer examplesHe was hauled up in front of a magistrate.If he doesn't pay the fine soon, he'll be up before the magistrate.Paul is a magistrate.I'm doing a course for magistrates.How do you become a magistrate?.
